Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: CONCLUSIONS : Based on the results , S - 53482 and S - 23121 were teratogenic when administered dermally to pregnant rats as were the compounds administered orally .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Teratogenic effects on fetuses of pregnant rats (in rats) |

In this paragraph, the term "teratogenic" refers to a disease or condition that causes birth defects or developmental abnormalities in an embryo or fetus. The paragraph states that the compounds S - 53482 and S - 23121 caused this condition when administered dermally (on the skin) and orally (by mouth) to pregnant rats. Therefore, the disease entity is "teratogenic effects on fetuses of pregnant rats."

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Teratogenic effects on fetuses of pregnant rats |

In the revised paragraph, I have removed the references to the specific compounds (S - 53482 and S - 23121) as they are not diseases, but rather the agents causing the disease. The disease entity remains "teratogenic effects on fetuses of pregnant rats."
